volume.name: Zoned Comics: Bullies in a Strange Land

description:
We're back in the City that Never Sleeps for the final battle between the Ghostbusters and a rogue immortal who wants nothing more than control over the legions of Hell and dominion over the whole world! (Which sounds like Tuesday to us.) If they save the world, will the Ghostbusters ever venture beyond the five boroughs again without a massive retainer? Find out here in the GHOSTBUSTERS: INTERNATIONAL terrifyingly fun grand finale!

List of covers and their creators:

CoverNameCreator(s)Sidebar Location
RegRegular CoverDan Schoening1
SubSubscription CoverCorin Howell (a) & Jose Luis del Rio (c)2-3

Move over dinosaurs... monsters used to rule the planet! Travel to different time periods to examine the origin of myths that fueled nightmares! Feudal Japan, ancient Greece, medieval England, classic Rome, and The Cretaceous by a multitude of today’s best creators! Includes work by Ulises Farinas, Erick Freitas, Chris Mowry, Ryan Ferrier, Matt Frank, Tadd Galusha, Jeff Zornow, and more!
name: TPB

description:
Launching from the events of REVOLUTION! The M.A.S.K. team streaks into a dangerous, unstable landscape of dark wars, high intrigue and non-stop action where they’ll encounter the nearly unstoppable threat of Miles Mayhem and his black ops squadron known as V.E.N.O.M. How will an untested Matt Trakker lead M.A.S.K. through a complex new world order where nothing is what it seems? Join writer Brandon Easton (Marvel’s Agent Carter), artist Tony Vargas (Rot and Ruin) and cover artist Tommy Lee Edwards for an exciting 21st century spin on the classic series where “illusion is the ultimate weapon!”

List of covers and their creators:

CoverNameCreator(s)Sidebar Location
RegRegular CoverTommy Lee Edwards1
Sub-ASubscription Cover AJoe Suitor2
Sub-BSubscription Cover BAndrew Griffith (a) & Jordi Escuin (C)3
Sub-CSubscription Cover CNone4
RI-A1:10 Retailer Incentive Cover ASara Pitre-Durocher5
RI-B1:25 Retailer Incentive Cover BSonny Liew6
RI-C1:50 Retailer Incentive Cover CPaul Pope (a) & Jordie Bellaire (c)7
REDiamond UK Retailer Summit Exclusive Variant CoverAndrew Griffith8

Note: Includes an interview with Doug Stone.

concept_credits.name: Diamond Retailer Summit Exclusive Variant Cover

first_appearance_concepts.name: Diamond Retailer Summit Exclusive Variant Cover

description: It’s an epic-length Disney Comics treasure hunt—complete in one book for the first time! When Mickey Mouse, Donald Duck, and Uncle Scrooge McDuck team up to find and reassemble the twelve pieces of a powerful future-predicting amulet, they’re in for trouble with everything from lions, tigers, and ghosts to old enemies Pegleg Pete, Magica De Spell, and the Phantom Blot!
name: HC

volume.name: Mickey and Donald: The Search For the Zodiac Stone

description: It’s a “lost” 1965 Disney epic, deemed too wild for publication and saved only in tantalizing fragments... or is it? When Pegleg Pete and the Beagle Boys shrink and steal Scrooge’s Money Bin, Mickey and Donald must track them down—in what is really a brand-new album-length thriller by comics masters Lewis Trondheim and Nicolas Keramidas: told in an amazing indy style and presented like a treasure suspended in time!
name: GN

description:
LAST STAND IN AUTOBOT CITY! It’s all come to this—TRANSFORMERS vs. ROM vs. MICRONAUTS vs. G.I. JOE vs. M.A.S.K. vs. the ultimate evil! The futures of Earth, Cybertron, and the Microverse will all be changed forever by the decisions made this day.

List of covers and their creators:

CoverNameCreator(s)Sidebar Location
RegRegular CoverTradd Moore (a) & Felipe Sobreiro (c)1-2
Sub-ASubscription Cover ABrandon Peterson3
Sub-B"Official Handbook" Subscription Cover BJohn Byrne (a) & Len O'Grady (c)4-6
Sub-C"Propaganda" Subscription Cover CJames Biggie7
Sub-D"Imaginary 2-Pack Toy" Subscription Cover D (Baron Karza & Miles Mayhem)Adam Riches8
RI-A1:10 Retailer Incentive CoverKen Christiansen9
RI-B1:25 Retailer Incentive CoverGuido Guidi10
RI-C1:50 Retailer Incentive CoverArt Baltazar11

Note: Includes handbook entries for Optimus Prime, Windblade, Agent Helix & Phenolo-Phi.
name: Chapter 5: Valley Forge

description:
The action-packed first arc of TMNT Universe comes to a close as the Raphael makes an impossible choice and Baxter Stockman’s surprise gambit takes effect!

List of covers and their creators:

CoverNameCreator(s)Sidebar Location
RegRegular CoverFreddie E. Williams II1
SubSubscription CoverDamian Couceiro2
RI1:10 Retailer Incentive CoverAgustin Graham Nakamura3
name: [Untitled]; Inside Out Part 4

description:
The second book of The Obscure Cities series following The Leaning Girl. Gholam Mortiza Khan comes to Brüsel to sell some jewelry, but before the sale can be closed, Khan dies in an accident. Thus begin events sparking an investigation by Mary von Rathen: accumulation of sand in the apartment of Kristin Antipova; accumulation of stones in the house of Constant Abeels, and Maurice who is loosing weight by the day. The events have a catastrophic effect on Brüsel and time is of the essence.

Newly translated into English by Ivanka Hahnenberger and Steve Smith (translator of The Leaning Girl and The Beauty) and edited by Smith and Karen Copeland at Alaxis Press for publication by IDW.
name: GN

volume.name: Theory of the Grain of Sand

description:
Whether he's battling a malevolent mummy or keeping one breast-stroke ahead of Earth-drowning floods, Scrooge McDuck knows that his money comes first—and he'll do anything to keep it safe, especially with the Beagle Boys, rival tycoons, and hex-happy Magica De Spell lurking about! It's IDW's Uncle Scrooge #7–12 in a special collectors' hardcover: epic Disney tales by Romano Scarpa, Giorgio Cavazzano, and more, plus bonus Scroogian extras assembled just for this book. "Burst me bagpipes!"

Contents

  • Mummy Fearest (From Italian Topolino #1190 (1977))
  • Of Mice and Magic (From Dutch Donald Duck #5/1980)
  • Peril of Pandora's Box (From Dutch Donald Duck #33/2003)
  • Sleep Tight (From Italian Topolino #2922 (2011))
  • The Doorman Doormat (From Swedish Kalle ANka & C:o #15-16/2011)
  • The Dashingest Dudebro (From Dutch Donald Duck #44/1995)
  • Another Christmas on Bear Mountain (From Italian Topolino #2717 (2007))
  • Blizzard Blues (From Dutch Donald Duck #50/1995)
  • The Eternal Knot (From Italian Topolino #355 (1962))
  • Wrapped Up In Work (From Dutch Donald Duck #9/2004)
  • Love is Never Having to Say You're Sentenced (From Danish Anders And & Co. #48/2009)
  • Scrooge's Ark Lark (From Italian Almanacco Topolino #273 (1979))
  • Bad Things Come In Threes (From Danish Anders And & Co. #39/2010)
  • Ten Little Millionaires (From Italian Topolino #2984 (2013))
  • Gem Scam Jam (From Italian Almanacco Topolino #92 (1964))
  • A Witch in Crime (From Swedish Kalle Anka & Co:0 #38/1984)
name: Volume 2

description:
“Came Back Haunted,” Part 3 of 4: In search of Mulder, Scully travels to Europe where each uncovers unpleasant secrets. And what connection does Firas Ben-Brahim have to both?

List of covers and their creators:

CoverNameCreator(s)Sidebar Location
RegRegular CoverMenton31
SubSubscription CoverPhoto2
name: Came Back Haunted Part 3

description:
It's Ole Golazo, our new Jump Start! Banba's spent his life competing in Tae Kwon Do, but he's been banned! Through a twist of fate, he ends up on the soccer team. Can he learn a new way to kick? Plus, more Demon's Plan and the final Red Sprite chapter!
